intro: Pterisanthes eriopoda, commonly known as the woolly pterisanthes, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
